data.message:
I wish I could find the words to tell
you how much you mean to me. I
wake up to your songs everyday as my
alarm on my phone to feel that I am
still alive each and every morning. I
talk about you to my family and to my
friends even though I know they
won't understand where I come from
when I say that you saved me. I
imagine meeting you and thanking
you for your music and staying strong
for your fans when your whole world
crumbled to bits. I rap along to every
verse, every lyric, move my hands to
every beat and remember that you
never gave up on us. I flash back to
that day when I saw your face and
got to scream your lyrics right to your
face instead of rapping them to the
posters of you on my wall. I will never
forget that moment that you came
onto the stage. I screamed so loud
my voice was lost by the end of the
night. I think about how much
emotion you are full of behind the
mic, even when people are too quick
to judge you. I almost got suspended
in school for standing up for you
when somebody wanted to disrespect
you. I wear your merch to school
almost everyday, and when I don't, I
feel as if my outfit isn't complete. I
write "EMINEM" on my wrist every
day to remind myself that if I get an
urge to harm myself, that I would not
only be hurting myself, but I would
be slicing right through your name. I
listen to your songs whenever I flash
back to my horrid past, and you make
my whole world brighter and make
me realize that life is worth living. I
watch 8 Mile whenever it's raining
out while I lay on my bed, look out
my window, and watch this world pass
me by. I get bullied almost every day
and whenever I need to, I just think
about you and realize that I'm not
alone in this world. I have an exact
number of 2,391 pictures of you saved
onto my phone. I put my headphones
on in between classes and listen to
you and feel like I'm walking in your
shoes with every song. I have
pictures of you on every inch of my
walls and I will probably never take
them off. I even have dreams where I
meet you and they seem so real and I
wake up almost in tears because I
hate the fact that I will most likely
never meet you, but I still have hope.
You have no idea how much me and
your fans truly care about you. If
anything ever happened to you, I
would be devastated. I know that it
will eventually happen one day, and
when that day comes, I will literally
lose myself. What I'm trying to say
is... thank you, Marshall Bruce
Mathers III, for being my hero and
making life worth living every single
day. You give me hope. You teach me
to not be afraid to be myself. You
teach me to stand up for myself even
if my voice shakes. You are like the
father figure that I've never had
growing up. I can't wait to see you
again and finally be so close to you
that you look out into the crowd and
make eye contact with me. I love you
more than life itself. Happy 42nd
fucking Birthday.
